title: Trying to recreate vintage ticket fonts
content: Does anyone have suggestions about what fonts to use to make vintage looking tickets. Also what is the font used for the numbers on stub tickets?
author: lthe

comments.content: For the numbers, check out the free [Crash Numbering Kit](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316201207/http:/www.psyops.com/html/library_crash.html) from PSY/OPS.

Hoefler & Frere-Jones have fun numbers too

[http://www.typography.com/catalog/numbers/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316201207/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/numbers/index.html "http://www.typography.com/catalog/numbers/index.html")

Tobias Frere-Jones designed a font called Garage Gothic which is based on the little red tickets they give you when you drop off your car.

[http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/GarageGothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316201207/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/GarageGothic "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/GarageGothic")
Tickets = what kind? Movie, train, steamship, airline, parking, laundry?
